plptool.dmf

Interface ModuleInterface5


  • public interface ModuleInterface5
    Module interface for PLPTool 5.x series. This supersedes the original PLPGenericModule interface from PLPTool 4.1. Although the old interface is still supported, this is the preferred method of implementing a PLPTool module.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getDescription()
      Return a description of the module that will be displayed in the module manager
      int[] getMinimumPLPToolVersion()
      Required minimum PLPTool version in integer array.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Module name to be listed in the Module Manager frame
      int[] getVersion()
      Module version in integer array.
      int initialize(ProjectDriver plp)
      Initialization function called by the framework as the module is loaded.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        int initialize(ProjectDriver plp)
        Initialization function called by the framework as the module is loaded. The framework passes the current project driver to the module and the module should keep this reference if it has to interact with the project at all. This is also the preferred place to register callbacks.
        Parameters:
        plp - A reference to the currently active project driver instance
        Returns:
        The module should return a status code. Anything other than PLP_OK will trigger an error during the loading process

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Module name to be listed in the Module Manager frame
        Returns:
        Module name as String

      • getVersion

        int[] getVersion()
        Module version in integer array. The array needs to have AT LEAST a major and minor version (index 0 and 1, respectively). If the returned array length is less than 2, an error will be thrown.
        Returns:
        Module version as integer array with at least a length of 2

      • getMinimumPLPToolVersion

        int[] getMinimumPLPToolVersion()
        Required minimum PLPTool version in integer array. The array needs to be of exactly length of 2.
        Returns:
        Required minimum PLPTool version as integer array with at least a length of 2

      • getDescription

        java.lang.String getDescription()
        Return a description of the module that will be displayed in the module manager
        Returns:
        Module description as string
